name: Paros
description: Big white sandy beach with lots of space for launching and landing, clear from obstacles.

name: Rhodos
description: The beach is big around 500-600m. In summer there are many cars and visitors. But there is space for everyone. Be careful with your camper. With high winds and tide the water can get very high. Camping is allowed and there are many in summer (around 100).

name: Lefkada
description: The beach is facing Northwest. It has nice, smooth pebbles, but you can find big but smooth rocks as soon as you get in the water. Lots of space to launch your kite. This is a 5km sandy beach with no trees anywhere. Even in the back there is a lake. The beach is dirty, a lot of waste from sea. And also glass. Be careful.

name: Corfu
description: Sandy beach. Situated in a natural reserve. Easy launch and kiting area. Many tourists during summer.

name: Crete
description: Beach is sandy and wide. There is a nice large space to launch between windsurfers and swimmers. Not many people.

name: Naxos
description: Nice sandy beach, enough space. Launching area in front of the school.

name: Rhodos
description: The beach is about 20-25m wide. Then there are trees and a small road. It's a stone beach. The beach is a bit small and not the best place for kitesurfing. The area to enter the water is limited by buoys to distinguish the kite area from the swimming area. It is therefore important to be able to stay upwind. It is possible to launch further up the beach, then you will have a long downwinder back to the kitecenter.

name: Kos
description: There is enough place at the beach. Respect and take care if there are swimmers. The beach is sandy, sometimes there are some broken bottles. After the beach there are bushes/trees. Take care of the pipe who enters the sea from the salt lake.

name: Limnos
description: We travel for holidays at Limnos Island and the Keros beach. What we found in this kitesurf, windsurf spot was completely unpredictableworst kitesurf spot. 5 km beach full of seaweeds, half area of the beach have gusty wind, half prohibited and illegal crazy kiteschools. 2 km is taken from schools that are illegal cause they extend their limits to the beach so much that TheyDONT ALLOW TO ANYONE KITE IN THEIR area except if you pay them. Also they close their limits to eachother, so there isn't space for tourists or visitors for using the water, but only for their customers.. Their license is until 200m2 area and they extend it illegally until 3000m2.What about the rest of the beach?The port police have been placed balloons in the water to close the area to protect 30 swimmers only. This area extend in2km distance on the beach, where is prohibited for kitesurfers or windsurfers . Port police are very strict for applying this law to kitesurfers or windsurfers but they ignore the kiteschools that are force you to pay for using the water or that they extend their area..We were 7 families that we have babies and we need umbrellas and they forced us to kite far away in a rocky, unprotected, without coffee-bars or umbrellas 200m beach area..All kitesurf, windsurf visitors were so disappointed..!! i felt very bad!

name: Kos
description: Long sandy beach. The permitted kite-zone was moved further downwind where the beach is only about 10 m wide. The presence of trees on this small beach makes launching and landing there very tricky.

name: Lake Balaton
description: No more sandy beach as the water level got higher.

name: Lake Balaton
description: The beach 500m long and 60m deep, covered with grass. The beach is quite busy and not so big, therefore it's quite difficult to launch and land the kite. Beach is mostly grass, with some rocks as coast protection. Some trees and buildings on the beach but wide enough to launch relatively safely.

name: Bull Island
description: The beach is 3km long, compact sand, car accessible. Rocks about 100m either side of the entrance to stop people driving the length of the beach. Not really any hazard to kitesurfers.

name: Sandymount Beach
description: It is a long and quiet beach with firm sand, but disappears when the tide is in.

name: Shitties
description: Long, sandy beach. Lots of space.

name: Tramore
description: Tramore beach is 5km long with high sand dunes but it is also very stony particularly near the promenade so for a more sandy feel it is best to walk towards the other end of the beach.

name: Benone Beach
description: Benone Beach is quite isolated and therefore there is little to offer those not participating in the beach based sports with the obvious exception of sun bathing! The beach is exceptionally long and smooth with firm sand.

name: Streedagh Beach
description: Northwest facing sandy bay, bending around to west, southwest facing, a long beach, over 2 km with sand dunes.

name: Duncannon
description: The beach is 1.2 km long and is wide on low tide with firm smooth sand.

name: Ballycotton
description: Large beach of sand with seaweed and some waste litter. Enough space to launch the kite, watch the walkers on Sundays and during summers though. No shower nor toilets.

name: Monkstown
description: Salthill/Monkstown beach opens to the north consisting of sand and large rocks. The beach is life guarded from June to August from 10:30 to 7 pm. Lots of rocks and concrete walls. Also electrical lines for the Dart (public rail transport) are directly behind the beach. Launch area is really small on high tide but runs out 300m on a low tide.

name: Lake Como
description: Beach partly sand and partly grass. Upwind kitebeach, downwind windsurf. The beaches are quite nice and clean but sometimes some rubbish due to storms or something else. The launch it's quite safe, some trees around, but not a problem. Some stones in the water.

name: Marina Julia
description: Sand and pebbles. Enough space to safely launch and land a kite. Special kite entry and exit zone. During summer many tourists on the beach.

name: Sicily
description: Nice and soft sand. Long beach, but packed with tourists during summer.

name: Sardinia
description: Wide beach with fine sand. Lots of space for landing and starting. Packed beach during holidays. Special kite zone during summer.

name: Lake Garda
description: Very small with rocks. You can launch only one kite a time. Not a good place for beginners. Very busy during summer.

name: Sardinia
description: Approx. 4km sand beach with the harbor of La Caletta in the North and a small village in the South with rocks you should avoid. The beach is in average 30 meters wide. Only sand without rocks, corals, shells. Nice spot, not crowded at all during spring and autumn. Quite save since the bay is so big and the whole beach is sandy.

name: Lago Di Resia
description: The local kitesurfing club provides an area for launching and landing (grass). Only there it is allowed! Foil and tube zones are separated (see billboard at the spot for additional info). In spring you can use the large alluvial fan that is created by the small glacial stream.

name: Sicily
description: No real beach, launch from the water.

name: Lake Garda
description: Beach is little and rocky, you have to follow local rules.

name: Jurmala
description: Nice soft sand. Long beach with lots of space.

name: Bullji
description: Nice, long and sandy beach. Lots of space.

name: Pavilosta
description: Rocky spot. Parking right at the beach. Very popular place for local windsurfers and kiteboarders to go on weekends. Enough space for everyone.

name: Liepaja Karaosta
description: Sand and asphalt. You can park your car near the beach.

name: Ventspils
description: Long, sandy beach with lots of space.

name: Kolkarags
description: Nice soft sand on both sides of the point. Lots of space.

name: Liepaja
description: Long sandy beach, lots of space.

name: Jurkalne
description: A cliff next to the small beach.

name: Monciskes
description: Clean, sandy beach. Long beach with lots of space for kites to safely launch and land. In summertime lots of people sunbathing on the beach. Be careful.

name: Kunigiskes
description: Nice soft sand. Enough space to safely launch and land kites.

name: Neringa
description: Seaside: a 30m wide beach, white sand, no stones or rocks, during summer time a bit crowded.

name: Giruliai
description: A 30m wide beach, white sand, no stones or rocks, at summer time a bit crowded. But if there is wind, the beach becomes empty (of holiday makers).

name: Juodkrante
description: Not very crowded but do not kite in public beach, for tourist safety reasons.

name: Rekyva Lake
description: Small sandy beach. Trees right next to it.

name: Silva Spot
description: Small area with grass, sand and stones.

name: Rekyva Lake
description: Small sandy beach. Trees right next to it.

name: Elektrenai Lake
description: Grassy beach with quiet some space.

name: Dusia Lake
description: Small accesses around the lake. Find one depending on the wind directions.

name: Mellieha Bay
description: Sandy bay, rocks on sides, and some in the middle. Very packed beach in summer. Small beach, you must be an advanced kiteboarder because beside the beach there are the road and electric wires, you have to be careful.

name: Velika Plaza Ulcinj
description: 13km long, 60m wide. Very nice, soft sand, no shells. Lots of space for launching. No buildings and obstacles.

name: Brouwersdam
description: The beach itself is very wide (like 200m average even on high tide) and long maybe 2km or more. It consists out of soft sand with here and there some shells. At the water line there's a stroke of harder cleaner sand. In general it's kite friendly (if you look out for shells). Safe launching: to begin with the beach is huge, so space enough always you would say. Problem is the hard packed sand makes the beach also a Mekka for kite-buggiers and a like. Fortunately this isn't really a problem. But on very hot and steamy day's (when it mostly doesn't blow anyway), it can be crowded with people, and you have to watch out in the water and at the shore line. Most of the time there's room enough though, and you can launch and land safely. Entries: lots of them, the beach lays against a dune stroke with a road behind it, you can park all along the beach (for free), and every 100-200 m there's an entry.

name: Ijsselmeer
description: Open sandy beach. Wastebaskets and other objects form a risk in gusts. As always best to launch in the direction of the water. Areas with grass to pump up the kite.

name: Ijsselmeer
description: Small sandy beach and big grass area. Enough space for safe starting/landing. Nice small restaurant.

name: Oostvoorne
description: The beach is very huge, so launching is not a problem. With low tide you must walk a few hundred meters to reach the water. At low tide there are some wooden sticks (not many) so watch out a bit. Safe, since there is always shore. At high tide the beach can get small.

name: Breezand
description: Beach is a few hundred meters wide. Also very long beach. Soft sand with shells, so be careful not to damage your kite. Lots of space. But during high season look out for beach goers.

name: Zandvoort
description: All sand no rocks, can be narrow at high tide but long enough. Only crowded in the summer. Lots of beach houses.

name: Ijmuiden
description: Big sandy beach. This beach is the widest beach in the Netherlands. Never too crowded. If you stay at the entry of the beach, yes everybody is hanging around on a small spot (lazy bones). Just 4 minutes walking and the beach is empty. A lot of shelfs though.

name: Neeltje Jans
description: Sandy beach. There are some shells on the sand but not much. There is room enough to safely launch your kite. With high tide however the beach becomes somewhat narrow. Entry: take the entry at the parking lot below the viaduct, not the parking lot where the wind-turbines are. Because it can be crowded there with tourists.

name: Noordwijk
description: Sandy beach for miles and miles. But it is not allowed to kite in front of the two boulevards, except for the spot of the surf club, on the south boulevard. Also miles of beach left to the south and to the north.

name: Grevelingenmeer
description: Fairly large grass strip, which is easy to reach via the parking lot (it's next to it). At the waters edge there are rocks (wear shoes!). The grass allows to launch safely, in most wind directions. Some areas with small piece of grass, sharp rock and then the water with the same sharp rocks on the bottom.

name: Solastranden
description: Nice and sandy beach. Enough space. Launching north of the Sola Beach Hotel only. Never further south due to the airstrip.

name: Larkollen
description: Mostly sand, some rocks to the west. Some shells. Can be rather crowded on good days. You can land your kite behind some trees.

name: Borestrand
description: Beautiful, soft sand. Lots of space for safe launch and landings. Behind the beach there are sand-dunes with grass.

name: Sande
description: Thin sandy beach. Enough space to launch.

name: Hafrsfjord
description: This is a Fjord situated in both residential and agricultural land. There are a number of small man made beaches to launch from. If the wind is light be careful as it may not be possible to land on a beach and you may need to ditch your kite in the water. Lots of man made hazards such as moored boats, jetties and houses. Would not go there if you are a kitesurf beginner.

name: Orrestranda
description: Nice and soft sand. Big space to lay out your kite and lines and to launch and land safely. Can be a bit crowed on the warmest days in summer.

name: Akrasanden
description: Medium sized, sandy beach with rocks.

name: Hamresanden
description: Very nice sandy beach with a nice launching spot. Plenty of launching and landing room. Some rocks by the seaside make most bathers prefer the more secluded inner beach. Even during summer. The beach is shallow for very long and then suddenly drops. Watch out for shells. If you spend some time walking upwind, it is recommended that you use shoes all year round to prevent cuts in the foot sole. Two beaches downwind exit points. The first right next to the launching spot, the next in the inner bay by the road. This one has a nice grassy area for landing.

name: Cypel
description: The beach in Rewa is very nice and it's a real attraction of the region with its national park It's a 1 km long sandy peninsula. The spot is extremely safe with its open space and no trees in surroundings. There is a lot of space to launch and land a kite. The beach is sandy but after storms might occur pebbles.

name: Hel
description: The best sand, very fine and soft, no rocks, no shells, no pebbles, no dangerous things in the water. The beaches are very big and wide so there is no problem with kite landing or launching. It's a bay which can be used in any wind direction if you have a car. If you don't than you can always chose between bay or see. On the sea side the beach is large enough to prepare your gear to launch - on the gulf side the situation isn't so good. It depends on which camp you are at. Very crowded in summer time.

name: Hel
description: Nice and soft sands on bay side and seaside beach. Lots of space on the ocean side. Small beach on the bay side, but lots of shallow water, so no problem to launch from the water.

name: Swinoujscie
description: Long, sandy beach. Packed in summer.

name: Jezioro Lebsko
description: Grass with a little bit of sand.

name: Jezioro Miedwie
description: Small sandy beach with grass area next to it.

name: Hel
description: Nice and soft sands on bayside and seaside beach. Lots of space on the ocean side. Small beach on the bay side, but lots of shallow water, so no problem to launch from the water.

name: Kaliszanskie
description: Beach crowded during summer, almost impossible to launch from the main beach. Very few other places to launch, possible on western shore. Lots of bushes and cane all around.

name: Miedzyzdroje
description: The beach is wide and 15 km long with beautiful sand, almost no shells, and some small stones, very clean. The access is free of charge. Launch and land kites are easy and safe, however could be crowded sometimes.

name: Alvor
description: Large beach, almost desert beach. Access mainly by boat. White sand! Big pier to the west.

name: Guincho
description: Guincho is fabulous. It looks a bit scary when seen from the sea because of the rocky surroundings. This is good because people respect it and there are very little accidents. Rocks in each side and at the center of the beach. The beach is very deep and wide and there is lots of free space at the beach because beach crowd goes away from the strong wind. One exit at each end. There aren't much shells, no concrete and no grass. You have enough space to launch your kite with safety. There are no special entries, you just drive there along the road, stop your car on the side way, and walk to the beach!

name: Lagoa
description: Normal sand. Kite spot near the sea, windsurfing spot in the middle.

name: Ilha
description: Nice beach with lots of space. In summer time you must walk more to the left and you have almost the beach only for you, it is a really good spot. No problems to launch the kite.

name: Peniche
description: Big sandy beach with lots of space.

name: Nova Vaga
description: Awesome beach, soft sand without any kind of rock, shells or pebbles, a lot of space so all the crowd can ride safely. Big sand dunes to get to the sea front and about 50 meters of sand from the dunes to the water front.

name: Gaia
description: Nice soft beach with white sand and lots of space near the pear. North side with rocks and perfect waves.

name: Praia
description: Nice large beach with enough space to launch safely.

name: Carcavelos
description: Nice sand, large area for kite landing in winter with low tide. Be careful with road proximity. Watch for the fortress as well.

name: Foz
description: Big sandy beach. Lots of space.

name: Kazeboo
description: Nice sand, many hotels, good resort at Black See, crowded during season.

name: Lacul Morii
description: Artificial lake inside Bucharest, no beach, only cement construction around. You can launch and land the kite from the water.

name: Vama Veche
description: Sandy beach. Crowded in summer.

name: Mangalia
description: The beach is very wide and has designated places for sports area and sunbathing area.

name: Sulina
description: Wind is quite strong on this part of the Black Sea Beach side.

name: Siutghiol Lake
description: Siutghiol Lake is bordering on the north side Mamaia Beach City and the kiters/surfers can enjoy the Black Sea beach few hundred meters away from the lake.

name: Mihailesti Lake
description: The area is rural type with no villages close by, some parts of the shore has sand, other parts have grass. It's usually used for weekend picnics and of course many kiters or windsurfers from the area.

name: Plesheevo Lake
description: The main kite beach is soft grass. There is enough place for launch the kite and for beginners.

name: Doljanka
description: On summer months, holidays or special events beach can be crowded.

name: Kiziltashsky Liman
description: There is a beach 100 meters from the Liman (salty lake), andit is a Black Sea beach, very wide and sandy. Liman it has lots of places for a launch. Just pick your launch depending on the wind conditions.

name: Voronezh
description: Small sandy beach with some grass and trees. There is enough space for launch, but this beach is not for kite beginners.

name: KiteBeach Kaliningrad
description: Medium sized beach with sand and grass.

name: Kurshskaya Kosa
description: Long sand beach on the sea with little people in May and September, more crowded in June to August. Suitable for kiting on the whole sandbar. On the gulfside certain sand spots of about 30-50 m width. Good beach only in Morskoye.

name: Pavlo
description: During summer months the beach can become very crowded on weekends.

name: Yasenka
description: Fine shell rock, beaches of the big extent, many convenient places for kiting and windsurfing, big deserted beaches. Opportunity to choose a convenient beach for different wind directions.

name: St
description: Long sandy beach all the way along the St. Andrews golf course. Lots of space. Can be dangerously busy in high summer though, so please be careful launching and landing kites. Huge at low tide. Fine, hard packed sand. Few obstacles. Perfect.

name: Pettycur Bay
description: 4 miles of flat soft sand bar, no rocks, enough space to launch and land the kite. Watch out for the cliff and harbor that are downwind in a SW. Set up on the main (big) beach. There is a smaller beach near the harbor, separated by a rocky outcrop - this is your emergency landing if it all goes wrong.

name: Balmedie Beach
description: The beach is 11 miles of golden sand backed by a massive dune system. When the tide goes out there is a large area of flat sand that dries out quickly. Sometimes large pools can be created depending on the sea conditions in the prevailing months which make it great for teaching. During most of the year there is normally a large area of soft sand between the high tide mark and the dunes. This sometimes disappears during high tide and winter storms. Hopefully the snow has fallen in the hills less than 80 miles away so we do a bit of snow kiting instead.

name: Shell Bay
description: Sand for miles, a bit of shell on the high tide mark, hence the name. No real launch space at high tide.

name: Barassie
description: Situated at the southern end of of 15km Irvine bay, has huge area of sand from mid to low tide with great shallow play areas behind the numerous sand banks. High tide is safe for launching as there is a large area of grass between the beach and main road. Park practically on the beach if you like but should be mind full to stay upwind of the kites. Generally this area is safe and hazard free for kitesurfing and never very crowded with other beach users even in the hight of summer.

name: Fraserburgh
description: Fantastic 3 miles golden horse shoe shaped, sandy beach.

name: Troon South Beach
description: No obstacles, except in storms when the rivers tend to flush out tree stumps etc.

name: Isle
description: Sandy beach with rocks at both ends.

name: Ardrossan
description: About 1 km long beach, directly between Ardrossan and Saltcoats.

name: Kralova
description: The grassy beach is about 20 m wide, so you can start from the water. There are a lots of bushes on the beach. Starting and landing is uncomfortable.

name: Kralova
description: Small beach with grass and little sand.

name: Kralova
description: Small sandy beach with grass behind it.

name: Kralova
description: The grassy beach is about 20 m wide, so you can start from the water.

name: Izola
description: Stony beach with some obstacles, but safe for kitersurfers if used on the most downwind place. Enough place to easy rig and launch a kite, some concrete and rock.

name: Piran
description: Rocks and stones. Very tiny beach.

name: Bohinjsko Jezero
description: Small grassy area. During summer lots of windsurf gear. The marked spot is mostly for windsurfers. If you continue up in the bay NE then you will find a small entrance in between the trees. The wind is completely onshore.

name: Kamesnica
description: Very small place for launching the kite. Tricky.

name: Tarifa
description: Very long big beach which in summer gets extremely overcrowded. No shells just fine sand.

name: Los Canos
description: Sand with rocks. No problem for windsurfers. Kitesurfers should enter the water near the lighthouse: more space, sand and less rocks.

name: St
description: Very long, sandy beach. Lots of access to the beach, but not all for free. Via the camping grounds a fee will be charged.

name: Mallorca
description: Sandy beach 6km long. Enough space to launch and land in Can Pastilla. Right next to the harbour is a huge field of hard sand with soft sand closer to the waterline. Here is the kite launch zone. The rest of the beach is very packed in summer and should be avoided. Too many people and the risk of hurting someone is very high!

name: Castelldefels
description: Soft sand, no rocks, 50-100 m wide beach. Very long beach.

name: Valdevaqueros
description: Large area with sand about 50m wide. Many kitesurfers during summer. Large area with sand about 50m wide.

name: Los Lances
description: Big, sandy beach. Lots of space, but during summer many kite instructions on the beach.

name: Santa Pola
description: Wide and long sandy beach. Lots of place for rigging and launching. Houses along the beach.

name: Getares
description: Big, sandy beach, lots of space. A grassy area just behind the beach.

name: Mallorca
description: Sandy beach, about 2 km long and at the beginning about 150m deep. Enough space for launching and landing. Can be crowded in summer and empty in the other seasons. The beach has a lot of seaweed between beach and water.

name: Habo Ljung
description: Narrow sand beach. Nice grass area for launch and landing.

name: Oeland
description: Mostly grass, sand or small pebbles close to the water. Some pine trees close to the beach, not suitable for self start/landing.

name: Lagans Mynningen
description: The beach is clean and just in front of a `national park`. The space to launch is huge. Because the popular beach is three miles away no problems with crowds.

name: Are Sjoen
description: Small, sandy beach. beach goers during summer.

name: Askims Badet
description: Launch from the main beach or from a very small area on a little island on the other side of the camping area called Marholmen (not in summer).

name: Rullsand
description: The sandy beach is 600m long and up to 30m wide. Good space for kite launching and landing. Hard to use during summer bathing season (July). Two areas are available: Rullsand close to the mouth of Dalaevlen and the more lagoon like Braemsand directly to the east. Both areas, especially Braemsand can be crowded with bathers during nice warm day from end of June to beginning of August.

name: Klagshamn North Shore
description: Fairly narrow sand beach which is crowded during summer months. In summer launch on sandbar 100m east of beach.

name: Lomma
description: Big meadow. Stony beach. Big sandbar in front of the beach with lots of space to launch from.

name: Schweitzerbadet
description: Small sandy beach, but OK to launch and land for experienced riders. Restrictions during June to August due to lots of people at the beach. Fairly narrow comparing to international beaches.

name: Oeland
description: Sandy, very wide at some places, really nice, lots of space during the off season, but during the summer it will get very crowded if the weather is nice.

name: Silvaplana See
description: There is no sandy beach, but from the launch/land side there is a big area of grass the whole way down the lake (600m) and again 500m up on the other side where you normally arrive, if your kite drops and you are not able to relaunch again. So it's safe. There is one official entry but you can get out (back on shore) everywhere if you manage 30 cm of stones which are around at waterside. On the weekends it's normally a little bit crowded to get in. Sometimes you have to wait one minute before launching you kite. Upward from the official kite launching zone there is no way to start your kite. There are also a lot of windsurfers, so respect the zones in the water.

name: Bielersee
description: There is no sandy beach. There are kind of lagoons of gravel. The space to launch the kite is limited due to trees and has hazardous obstacles. Normally this beach is only used by kiteboarders. Windsurfers are starting some 200m away.

name: Lac De Neuchatel
description: Small sandy beach. In summer watch the people. Not much space, be careful.

name: Lake Geneva
description: Small beach of stones with onshore wind (30 meters long). You have to take off your kite and jump into water at the end of the beach. To come back on shore just go upwind of the beach and land your kite. Do not be alone on this spot! But do not be more than three riders as well.

name: Lake Geneva
description: Sandy beach. Packed in summer.

name: Bodensee
description: Pebble beach. Big meadow next to it. Trees along the shore.

name: Bodensee
description: No real beach, just a small area with a small creek (Eschlibach). Trees close by.

name: Lake Geneva
description: There is a grass area for rigging. The shore itself is made out of rocks which are roughly 1m high. Caution: It is not easy and safe to get in and out with a kite in the air.

name: Pirlanta Beach
description: Sandy beach, nice and soft, no shells, no rocks, no concrete. There is enough space to launch and land kites safely. The beach is about 200m wide and 500m long. Blue flagged, no other sports activities (forbidden from the government) just kitesurfing is allowed.

name: Gokova
description: The beach is 3 km long and doesn't have any rocks, buildings, power lines or any other obstacles which might be dangerous for kiteboarding. There is a very large area to raise and land your kite on the beach. Even though there are some swimmers and beach users on some parts of the beach, our training location is far from all of these in a very convenient area.

name: Fener
description: The main beach indicated is reserved for windsurfers (and sunbathers). There is a small, narrow, sandy beach just round the headland which lies West of the main beach. Not many sunbathers or swimmers, even in August, though some so you need to take care. Though beach is small, launch and landing are straightforward. Local school even teaches from this beach, but it isn't ideal for beginners.

name: Alacati
description: It is around 1 km wide. There is very little sand. Lots of little shells. There is great space of launching in the shallow water. Actually it is a huge bay.

name: Gokceada
description: The beach is nice and there is soft sand. There is a dune where you can put gear not in use. The shelf is good and there is no rocks or threes. There is enough space for landing or safety launch.

name: Calis Beach
description: Long and sandy bay. Sand and pebbles, plenty of space to launch by the surf center.

name: Akyarlar
description: Small sandy beach, not much space. Too packed during summer.

name: Bitez
description: Sandy bay. Lots of beach goers.

name: Ozlen Beach
description: 18 km of soft sandy beach with sand dunes and forest behind the beach. Plenty of space. Most of the time empty beach, because of the protected status. No tourism. 2 entries.

name: Iztuzu
description: Very long and big sandy beach. Lots of space.

name: Skadovsk
description: Grassy rigging area. Very safe location.

name: Kazantip Bay West
description: Long, sandy beach, about 10-15m wide.

name: Dnepr
description: Beach is a big spot with grass, huge space for launching and landing. Good place for beginners also.

name: Kazantip Bay East
description: Very long, sandy beach with pebbles. Some flat concrete obstacles at the waterline.

name: Krym
description: Very long beach, about 40m wide. Many beachgoers during summer.

name: Djnepr
description: Medium sized sandy beach. Look out for broken glass.

name: Kirillovka
description: Nice sandy beach. Long beach with lots of space.

name: Newport Beach
description: Go to the southern end if the beach is busy although this is only likely in peak summer periods. Outside of peak periods good learning venue at low tides loads of space for those embarrassing drags up the beach. Access by car park.

name: Rest Bay
description: Big open sandy beach approx 2 miles long facing Southwest.

name: Coney Beach
description: Soft sand at high tide, hard towards low tide.

name: Swansea Bay
description: Big sandy beach. At low tide you have to walk a bit. Various rocky outcrops to look out for and shifting sand and mud. Low amount of people on the beach during the winter and autumn. Only people walking dogs. During University summer term, lost of students on the beach on nice days.

name: Aberavon
description: Big sandy beach approx. 3 miles long. Very popular kitesurf beach in South Wales attracting people from all over South West Wales and England. Sand is hard at mid to low tide and popular with buggy and ATB kiters. Please use the far West end of the beach past the concrete promenade.

name: Newgale Sands
description: Long beach. Wide at low tide, no beach at high tide.

name: Llangenith
description: Incredible beach at least a couple miles long, fair walk to the water at low tide, high tide brings water right up to the dunes. So much space makes it incredibly safe. Very clean.

name: Pembrey
description: Big, sandy beach with lots of space.

name: Llanelli
description: Tidal beach. Long walk to the waterline on low tide. The beach can vanish on a high high tide.

name: Llandudno Westshore
description: Sandy beach with lots of space during low tide. During high tide the beach gets narrow. Along the beach is a concrete wall. A long wave breaker to the north and south. A small one in the center, but the beach is long. Beginners should go further south towards the golf course in a W or NW wind, here is an area with no obstacles. Grassy rigging areas next to the beach.
